did.head: Papers Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Baylor University, The Keston Center for Religion, Politics, and Society

did.abstract: The Katharine Murray Papers contain materials produced or collected by Katharine Murray, a former staff member of the Keston Institute in Oxford, United Kingdom.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: Katharine Murray earned a degree in French and Russian from Manchester University and in September 1972, joined the Center for Study of Religion and Communism (Keston College) staff where she focused on research and writing for publications. One article appeared in the first issue of the journal Religion in Communist Lands, and she collaborated with Michael Bourdeaux on Young Christians in Russia (Lakeland, 1976). She left full-time employment with Keston in 1974 due to pregnancy but continued to assist with various projects for several years.

In the 1990s, Murray worked for the Institute for Bible Translation helping coordinate translation projects in minority languages of the former Soviet Union. She published the young adult novel Jake (Hodder & Stoughton Religious, 1993; Thomas Nelson, 1995) and became a licensed Lay Reader in the Church of England in 1996. From 2002 until her retirement in 2015, Murray served as a joint director of Sundial Garden Ltd., a horticultural retail nursery based in Devon, UK.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Katharine Murray Papers cover the period from 1979 to 1980 and relate to Katharine Murray’s work on a book about Russian Orthodox priest and religious dissident Father Dmitry Dudko. The materials include a manuscript, a publisher’s agreement, correspondence, research materials, and notes.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Keston Center received Katharine Murray Papers as a part of the Michael Bourdeaux Papers.
The Katharine Murray Papers are organized in one series: I. Literary Works.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: All requests for copying of materials must be submitted to the Keston Center for Religion, Politics, and Society in writing. Please use the Request Form for Copying Materials sheet. Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator (s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

userestrict.head: Use/Re-use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Katharine Murray Papers, Box #, Folder #, Keston Center for Religion, Politics, and Society, Baylor University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Described by Larisa Seago. Released on 2021-04-30.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: The series includes a manuscript of a book about Russian Orthodox Priest Father Dmitry Dudko, an agreement with Lutterworth Press, correspondence, research materials, and notes.
The series is in good condition.
